item.title: Getting Glusterd to start at boot on Centos
item.description: I’ve been working on a pair of Centos servers using GluserFS for a volume that is shared by various other servers. Each time the server reboots, I had to log in and manually start the service. Turns out this is due to the networking no yet being started when the glusterd service starts. I found this post with the solution: Execute systemctl enable NetworkManager-wait-online Add the following to /lib/systemd/system/crond.service under [Unit]: Requires=network.
